statements: SELECT * FROM employee_skill_gap_analysis;
SELECT employee_name, job_title, current_skills FROM employee_skill_gap_analysis;
SELECT employee_id, employee_name, recommended_learning_path FROM employee_skill_gap_analysis WHERE job_title = 'Engineer';
SELECT * FROM employee_skill_gap_analysis ORDER BY employee_name DESC;
SELECT DISTINCT job_title FROM employee_skill_gap_analysis;
SELECT * FROM employee_skill_gap_analysis WHERE job_title = 'Software Engineer' ORDER BY employee_name ASC LIMIT 5
SELECT employee_id, employee_name, job_title FROM employee_skill_gap_analysis WHERE employee_id IN (1, 3, 5) ORDER BY job_title DESC
SELECT employee_name, current_skills, recommended_learning_path FROM employee_skill_gap_analysis WHERE skills_needed LIKE '%Java%' OR skills_needed LIKE '%Python%'
SELECT * FROM employee_skill_gap_analysis WHERE current_skills NOT LIKE skills_needed
SELECT DISTINCT job_title FROM employee_skill_gap_analysis
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT employee_id, employee_name, skill_level FROM employees WHERE department = 'Marketing';
SELECT employee_name, department FROM employees WHERE skill_level > 3;
SELECT employee_id, skill_name FROM employees JOIN skills ON employees.skill_level = skills.skill_id;
SELECT employee_name, skill_name FROM employees INNER JOIN skills ON employees.skill_level = skills.skill_id WHERE employees.department = 'IT';
SELECT employee_name, department FROM employees WHERE skill_level > 2 ORDER BY employee_name ASC
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department = 'IT' AND skill_level >= 3 ORDER BY skill_level DESC, employee_name ASC
SELECT employee_name, skill_name, category FROM employees e JOIN skills s ON e.skill_level = s.skill_id WHERE e.department <> 'HR' ORDER BY employee_name ASC
SELECT employee_name, department FROM employees WHERE skill_level < 2 AND department <> 'Accounting' ORDER BY department ASC
SELECT * FROM skills WHERE category = 'Programming' ORDER BY skill_name ASC
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, department FROM employees WHERE skill_level > 2;
SELECT name, department, skill_name FROM employees JOIN employee_skills ON employees.employee_id = employee_skills.employee_id JOIN skills ON employee_skills.skill_id = skills.skill_id;
SELECT * FROM skills WHERE skill_category = 'Programming';

SELECT employee_id, name, department, skill_name FROM employees JOIN employee_skills ON employees.employee_id = employee_skills.employee_id JOIN skills ON employee_skills.skill_id = skills.skill_id WHERE skill_level >= 3;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department='IT' ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT name, department FROM employees WHERE skill_level > 3 ORDER BY department ASC, name ASC;

SELECT name, skill_name FROM employees JOIN employee_skills ON employees.employee_id = employee_skills.employee_id JOIN skills ON employee_skills.skill_id = skills.skill_id WHERE skill_level >= 2 ORDER BY name ASC, skill_name DESC;
SELECT department, COUNT(employee_id) AS employee_count FROM employees GROUP BY department HAVING employee_count > 1 ORDER BY employee_count DESC;

SELECT employee_id, name, skill_name, skill_category FROM employees JOIN employee_skills ON employees.employee_id = employee_skills.employee_id JOIN skills ON employee_skills.skill_id = skills.skill_id WHERE department='HR' ORDER BY name ASC, skill_category ASC, skill_name ASC;
SELECT employee_name, years_of_experience FROM Employees;
SELECT * FROM Departments WHERE department_id = 2;
SELECT employee_name, department_name, skill_name FROM Employees JOIN EmployeeSkills ON Employees.employee_id = EmployeeSkills.employee_id JOIN Skills ON EmployeeSkills.skill_id = Skills.skill_id;
SELECT * FROM Employees ORDER BY years_of_experience DESC;

SELECT employee_name, department_name, proficiency_level FROM Employees JOIN EmployeeSkills ON Employees.employee_id = EmployeeSkills.employee_id JOIN Skills ON EmployeeSkills.skill_id = Skills.skill_id WHERE proficiency_level > 2;
SELECT * FROM Employees;
SELECT employee_name, years_of_experience FROM Employees WHERE years_of_experience > 5;
SELECT employee_name, department_name FROM Employees JOIN Departments ON Employees.department_id = Departments.department_id;
SELECT employee_name, skill_name, proficiency_level FROM Employees JOIN EmployeeSkills ON Employees.employee_id = EmployeeSkills.employee_id JOIN Skills ON EmployeeSkills.skill_id = Skills.skill_id;

SELECT employee_name, department_name, skill_name FROM Employees JOIN Departments ON Employees.department_id = Departments.department_id JOIN EmployeeSkills ON Employees.employee_id = EmployeeSkills.employee_id JOIN Skills ON EmployeeSkills.skill_id = Skills.skill_id WHERE proficiency_level > 2;
SELECT * FROM Employee;
SELECT Name, Department FROM Employee WHERE SkillLevel > 2;
SELECT SkillName FROM Skill ORDER BY SkillName ASC;
SELECT PathName, OrderNum FROM LearningPath JOIN PathSkill ON LearningPath.PathID = PathSkill.PathID WHERE PathSkill.OrderNum < 4;
SELECT Employee.Name, Skill.SkillName FROM Employee JOIN EmployeeSkill ON Employee.EmployeeID = EmployeeSkill.EmployeeID JOIN Skill ON EmployeeSkill.SkillID = Skill.SkillID;
SELECT * FROM Employee WHERE Department = 'IT';
SELECT Name, SkillLevel FROM Employee ORDER BY SkillLevel DESC;

SELECT Employee.Name, Skill.SkillName FROM Employee JOIN EmployeeSkill ON Employee.EmployeeID = EmployeeSkill.EmployeeID JOIN Skill ON EmployeeSkill.SkillID = Skill.SkillID WHERE Employee.Department = 'HR';
SELECT Employee.Name, PathName FROM Employee JOIN LearningPath ON Employee.EmployeeID = LearningPath.PathID;
SELECT COUNT(EmployeeID) AS TotalEmployees, Department FROM Employee GROUP BY Department;
